name: Mini Durin
desc: A dragon from a magical world, created by a writer, Andersdotter.

customize.text: Mini Durin

One day, the witches of the Hexenzirkel — Andersdotter, Barbeloth, and Alice — created the magical world of Simulanka based on one of Andersdotter's fairy tales about paper animals. Alice created mountains and rivers and gave life to the people of Simulanka. Barbeloth induced the sky to spin and the earth to move. Andersdotter bestowed upon the people of Simulanka the fierce and everlasting feelings of love and hate and showed them the meaning of death and hope. In addition to paper animals and clockwork people, Andersdotter created the dragon Durin based on the creation of the witch, Rhinedottir.

The real Durin was a creature from the Abyss, so his blood was poisonous to all life in Teyvat. Five hundred years ago, when the dragon went to see the world and tell about his creator and brothers and sisters, he brought only death and destruction to people, and was defeated by the Anemo Archon, Barbatos, and his friend, the elemental dragon Dvalin. Durin's body fell onto a snowy mountain, which was later called Dragonspine. Like the real Durin, Durin of Simulanka had a sad fate: everything he touched turned into toy blocks, and the people of Simulanka were afraid of him. Despite Barbeloth’s warning of his fate intertwining with that of the real Durin’s, Andersdotter decided to let him into the world of Simulanka, becoming his mother. She believed that one day the people of Simulanka would choose their own path. Realizing that, unlike Alice and Barbeloth, she would not live long, she told Durin that she would become a star in Simulanka and would look down on him from above.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Go forth and witness this world, my child... Make sure to be nice to everyone...</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>You'll meet good friends one day, I'm sure of it... That is my wish for your future.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>As for this world... I leave it to you."</color>

When Durin was born, all the people began to fear him because he left huge marks when he landed on the ground. He did not want to harm anyone, but the people of Simulanka did not listen to him. Only one little flying squirrel considered him her friend since he always helped her pick flowers that she couldn't reach. But her mother, seeing them together, was afraid that Durin wanted to steal her child. When the dragon's mother, Andersdotter, died, he continued to look at the stars in the sky so that he would not be lonely. One day, the miners dug so deep that they broke through into the world on the next page, and Durin accidentally destroyed their mine. Then, he stole the stars from the sky of Constellation Metropole because he missed his mother. Numerous guards went to defeat the dragon but never returned. Realizing that the people of Simulanka would never accept him, the dragon made a wish never to be born.

When the dragon made a wish, several people holding Andersdotter's book at that time, entered the magical world of Simulanka to save it. Among them were the
the
of Constellation Metropole,
and the Traveler and Paimon. They rescued the paper animals and the clockwork men, returned the stars to the sky, and then went to fight the dragon. When they went to Durin's lair, they met miners who, like them, had come to defeat the dragon, but were unable to find their way back. Although everyone in Simulanka thought they were dead, the dragon did not harm them. In the dragon's lair, the Traveler and their companions saw Durin's memories of his birth, communication with Andersdotter, and his suffering when the whole world rejected him. Instead of fighting the dragon, they decided to talk to him, but people came to him year after year to cut off his head, so he joined the fight. Having weakened Durin, they were finally able to talk to him and convince him that he didn't really want to "not be born," but wanted to be accepted by this world and make friends. The Fairy of the Forest told Durin to make a wish to the Goddess of Fate, and together they gave him their blessing, turning him into a small harmless dragon — Mini Durin.

After Mini Durin's transformation, he and Wanderer set out to restore the houses in the forest that he had previously destroyed. Although the residents remembered past disagreements with the dragon, they were grateful to him for new homes and were always happy to have new ones. They even decided to organize a holiday in their honor. In Constellation Metropole, Mini Durin brought a whole supply of toy ore and vegetable oil to make amends. Most residents accepted his apology, but some said they would first see how he behaved next. When some of the people of Teyvat received an invitation to Simulanka, the dragon met the witch Alice's daughter, Klee, her "brother" Albedo, and the adventurer Fischl. Klee even drew him a map of Mondstadt, where her house was marked, so that Durin could visit her. Having created a magical boat named "Durin," capable of traveling to another world, the Wanderer and the dragon set off for Teyvat.

When the Wanderer saw Andersdotter and Barbeloth's memories of Mini Durin's creation, he heard a prophecy: <color=#ffffffd9>"R's child... will one day rise from the dead."</color> Fate in Simulanka was directly based on Teyvat. As Simulanka was a projection of the real world, the fate of this reflected world might have a reciprocal effect on Teyvat. Thus, Mini Durin's fate was intertwined with that of Durin of Teyvat, and changing the fate of the former could affect the latter. Observations on Dragonspine made by another of Rhinedottir’s creations, Albedo, revealed that Durin's heart was slowly returning to life. Albedo planned to formulate a plan of action for any possible scenario of Durin's return to life, including the most dangerous one. He hoped that if the prophecy came true and Durin's heart began beating again, it would not be an "evil dragon" who rose from the dead. Since the Wanderer had saved Mini Durin, their fates were intertwined, and Albedo asked them both to come to the aid of Mondstadt in their hour of need.

customize.text: Human Transmutation

Durin regained more and more life with each passing day, and the monsters under the influence of his power began to attack people and take their form to replace them. Realizing that the reborn shadow dragon could be dangerous for Mondstadt, Albedo decided to kill him and artificially revive him in another form using Mini Durin. After being resurrected, Durin would cease to be a monster and would no longer pose a danger to Mondstadt. Durin of Dragonspine was much more aggressive and primitive, and the pure side of Mini Durin of Simulanka was supposed to balance the evil side of the shadow dragon. The dragon from the fairytale land did not want to give up the name to another dragon and believed that he had the right to it. Mini Durin was afraid that by merging with Durin and becoming a human, he could cease to be himself, but he wanted his life to have a meaning: to defeat the evil dragon and become a human. Together with Albedo, they agreed to perform an alchemical ritual and transform Mini Durin into a human by human transmutation.

In order to obtain the materials for the transmutation and kill Durin, Albedo extracted the core from the dragon's heart, and its remaining body was stripped of its life force. To perform the ritual, the alchemist gained the approval of the witches of the Hexenzirkel and took the flesh of the immortal monster from the Mare Jivari and a fragment of the "embryo" from which Rhinedottir created her monsters. With the pure soul of a fairytale dragon, the blood from the original dragon's heart, and a body made from the immortal monster remnants and fragments of an embryo, Albedo began working on an alchemical model for the transmutation.

The corrosive nature of the dragon's venom and the heightened vitality of the monster's remnants were supposed to offset each other, keeping the constructed body in perfect balance. A powerful side effect would be triggered when festering forces and life energy collided in the form of the creation of new life. When the people of Mondstadt celebrated the Windblume Festival, Albedo performed an alchemical ritual that covered the entire city, and as a result, he created a synthetic human. Albedo and Mini Durin became the only beings in the entire world who owed their birth to alchemy and took human form. And if all living beings were divided by species, they would be the only representatives of their species. And although Mini Durin's body is still unstable, he fulfilled his dream and became a human.
